trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support for localization features to a root designer.

LocalizationExtenderProvider can extend an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner> with a set of properties and methods that provide support for the .NET Framework localization architecture.
For more about using resources, see [Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

The localization support architecture enables designers to initialize component properties using resource files that can be swapped at run time to support a variety of languages, culture-specific styles and dynamically configurable features.
You can use the methods of this class to enable designers and code generating serializers to load from resources and build initialization code that uses localization features.

The default serializers that ship with Visual Studio are already capable of localizing components and controls, but they only do so if they locate support for the .NET Framework localization architecture.
To detect the presence of localization support, the serialization system must locate a public <xref:System.Boolean> property named "Localizable" on the root designer component.
If a serializer finds this property, it searches for a property of type <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> named "Language" to determine the current resource configuration.

Default serializers use these properties to determine if it should localize any localizable resources of the component, and if so, what <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> format the resource information should be saved in.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider"></xref> class using the specified service provider and base component.

By default, a new <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider> sets the current language to <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.InvariantCulture%2A>, which is the generic and default language resource setting.
This setting causes a designer to generate code that references the generic language resource.
You can create other <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> objects to represent and identify other localized resource data that a program can use at run time.
A service provider for the specified component.
The base component to localize.
Indicates whether this object can provide its extender properties to the specified object.
The object to receive the extender properties.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this object can provide extender properties to the specified object; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider"></xref>.
Call <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider>.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider> in an unusable state.

After calling <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider> was occupying.
For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider> object's `Finalize` method.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()`method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LocalizationExtenderProvider> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to release both managed and unmanaged resources; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets the current resource culture for the specified object.
This method returns the current resource culture used to access resource data for the specified object.
The object to get the current resource culture for.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> indicating the resource variety.
Gets the default resource culture to use when initializing the values of a localized object at design time.
The object to get the resource culture for.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> indicating the resource culture to use to initialize the values of the specified object.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object supports resource localization.
The object to check for localization support.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified object supports resource localization; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Resets the resource culture for the specified object.

If the specified object was initialized with localized resources when the designer loaded, this method sets the resource culture for the specified object to the resource culture used to initialize the values of the specified object when the designer loaded.
If the specified object had no previous resource culture setting, the current resource culture is set to <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.InvariantCulture%2A>.
The object to reset the resource culture for.
Sets the current resource culture for the specified object to the specified resource culture.
The base component to set the resource culture for.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> that indicates the resource culture to use.
Sets a value indicating whether the specified object supports localized resources.
The base component to set as localizable or not localizable.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the object supports resource localization; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified object must have its localizable values persisted in a resource.
The object to get the language support persistence flag for.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the localizable values should be persisted in resources; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
